Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for containerized workloads, scalability, and integration with existing systems. Identify the applications and services that will be deployed on Azure Red Hat OpenShift.
Design the cluster architecture, including node sizing, networking, storage, and high availability configurations.
Secure necessary approvals and authorizations, including budgetary approval and compliance checks for deploying Azure Red Hat OpenShift.

Tasks.Task: Provision Azure Red Hat OpenShift Cluster
Tasks.Task Description: Deploy the Azure Red Hat OpenShift cluster using the Azure portal, CLI, or ARM templates. Ensure proper configuration of the cluster during provisioning.
Set up networking for the cluster, including virtual networks, subnets, and firewall rules. Ensure secure connectivity between the cluster and other Azure resources.
Enable security features such as role-based access control (RBAC), encryption, and integration with Azure Active Directory for authentication.
Deploy containerized applications to the Azure Red Hat OpenShift cluster. Configure application scaling, monitoring, and logging.
Set up monitoring and alerting for the cluster using Azure Monitor and OpenShift tools. Configure alerts for resource utilization, application performance, and security events.
Perform thorough testing of the cluster and deployed applications, including failover scenarios, performance tests, and security validations.
Document the cluster architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide training for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the setup.
Ensure the cluster setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Perform regular maintenance tasks such as patching, upgrades, and scaling of the cluster to meet evolving workload demands.
Continuously monitor the health and performance of the cluster using Azure Monitor and OpenShift tools. Address any issues promptly.
